results.title: Pistol opera
results.creator_credit: DENTSU, Eisei Gekijo Company, Ogura Jimusyo, Shochiku, Television Tokyo Channel 12, Katashima Ikki, Satoru Ogura and Seijun Suzuki
results.brief_description: In the late 60s, Seijun Suzuki developed a cult following with his re-envisioning of B-grade Japanese gangster flicks, defying the tropes of the genre with his desultory approach to narrative and imaginative stylistics. Here, freed of convention, Suzuki explores the possibilities of his art with astoundingly colourful and inventive vignettes that track the movements of Miyuki Minazuki, (also known as stray cat) a beautiful female assassin who dresses in black (with heels) and is determined to be number one amid her peers. This quest requires her to face down her many formidable foes and do battle, depicted in a series of extraordinarily beautiful tableaux. Stray cat must also deal with her lover and boss, a mysterious woman with whom she shares an explosive relationship. Absurdist and dreamily hallucinatory filmmaking, investigates shadowy, irrational aspects of desire. Somewhere between a remake and a sequel to Suzuki’s own cult movie “Branded to Kill” (1967). Cast includes Makiko Esumi, Sayoko Yamaguchi, Kan Hanae, Masatoshi Nagase, Mikijiro Hira, Kirin Kiki.

results.title: Pink Floyd: Pulse
results.creator_credit: Picture Music International (PMI), Pink Floyd (1987) Ltd, Lana Topham and David Mallet
results.brief_description: Recorded live at Earls Court, London on October 20th, 1994. This is classic Pink Floyd performing some of their best known music including “Learning to fly”, “Another brick in the wall”, “Money”, “Us and them”, and “Comfortably numb”. Features David Gilmour, Nick Mason and Richard Wright with Sam Brown, Claudia Fontaine, Durga McBroom on backing vocals, Jon Carin on keyboard and vocals, Dick Parry on saxophone, Tim Renwick on guitars and vocals and Gary Wallis on percussion.

results.title: Pillow talk
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Arwin Productions, Ross Hunter, Martin Melcher and Michael Gordon
results.brief_description: Doris Day is Jan Morrow, a single interior designer who has to share a telephone party-line with Brad Allen, a playboy musician played by Rock Hudson. His best-friend, millionaire Tony Randall, is in love with Jan. Brad thinks it would be fun to pretend to be someone else and see if he can woo Jan away from his friend. Things turn a little crazy, however, when he finds himself falling in love for the first time. The problem: Jan hates Brad. This crazy, funny love story is one of Hollywood’s camp classics, a delicious comedy about sex, virginity, and the games girls and boys play with each other. Though initially criticised as “superficial” by contemporary critics, in hindsight, the Hudson/Day romantic comedies still seem fresh in comparison to the “serious” Hollywood fare of its day. In part this comes from the playfulness with which Hudson and Day approach their roles, immersing themselves in their characters (she’s pure and virginal, he’s manly and a womaniser) at the same time investing enough subversive “queerness” in their roles to amuse those amongst us who may or may not be heterosexual. Features great songs, beautiful art direction and design, and a terrific supporting performance by Randall. Pure delight. Winner of an Academy Award for Best Screenplay.

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: McElroy & McElroy, Hal McElroy, Jim McElroy, Patricia Lovell and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1900 three girls from a private school and their teacher unaccountably vanish on a St Valentine’s Day school picnic to a mysterious rock in the midst of the Australian bush. The Victorian girls’ school for the daughters of the privileged gradually becomes contaminated and destroyed from within by its inability to understand the forces confronting it. Based on a novel which mythologises the emergence of sexuality, the film atmospherically follows various tangents without distilling a sense of explanation. Unease is evoked by the horror of not knowing. Based on the novel by Joan Lindsay. Cast includes Rachel Roberts, Dominic Guard, Helen Morse and Jacki Weaver.

results.title: Phenomena
results.brief_description: Creepy thriller from horror maestro Dario Argento features a strong performance from a very young Jennifer Connelly as an imperilled schoolgirl (also named Jennifer) who undergoes a series of frightening encounters whilst boarding at a Swiss finishing school. After experiencing nightmares that provide insight into a serial killer’s movements, Jennifer’s talent for communicating with insects links her to bug specialist Dr McGregor, with whom she aims to unmask the murderer. Engaging in the tropes of the genre - and using his trademark gore and gross-out aesthetics - Argento provides an array of thrills, scares and narrative twists all backed by a rock soundtrack. Uncut, uncensored widescreen edition. Also known as “Creepers” (US title).

results.title: Phar Lap
results.brief_description: Phar Lap, a big, bold chestnut horse, reigned as king of the turf in the Depression-gripped Australia of the 1930’s. From humble beginnings the New Zealand bred horse raced on to become the hero of the nation. With fame comes envy, intrigue and danger. In the quiet streets of Caulfield on Derby Day 1930, an attempt was made to kill the champion. On Melbourne Cup Day, Phar Lap passed into history with yet another win. Phar Lap’s fame spread to the United States where he won the Agua Caliente Stakes - the world’s richest race - effortlessly, despite an injury. Success bred hatred. Sixteen days later Phar Lap was dead. Australia was in mourning. To this day his death remains a mystery, but the legend remains - the legend of Big Red.

results.title: Performance
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Goodtime Enterprises, Sanford Lieberson, Donald Cammell and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: James Fox is Chas, a working-class London hitman, who is violent, cunning and ruthless. His growing arrogance results in a murder which sets his gangster boss against him. On the run, and fearing for his life, Chas holes up in the basement apartment of an ex-rock star (Mick Jagger) who lives with his two bisexual girlfriends (Anita Pallenberg & Michele Breton). The two men experience an initial repulsion then increasing fascination with each other, and under the influence of hallucinogenic drugs, they begin slowly to merge personas. This startling, original film uses the techniques and experiments of underground cinema to investigate the dislocation suffered by both bourgeois and working-class sexualities when confronted by the permissiveness of the hippie subculture. Fox, hard and masculine, and Jagger, soft and androgynous, both give two superb homoerotic performances. The electric rock score includes original music by Mick Jagger, The Last Poets and Ry Cooder.

results.title: Perdita Durango
results.creator_credit: Lolafilms, Sogetel, Mirador Films, European Script Fund, Canal+ Espana, Andres Gomes and Alejandro de le Iglesia
results.brief_description: The titular protagonist of “Perdita Durango” originated in the David Lynch film “Wild at heart”, as a character played by Isabella Rossellini. In this film Perdita (Rosie Perez) hooks up with Romeo Dolorosa (Javier Bardem) and the two cross the border into Mexico, embarking on a spree of violence, rape and murder. Romeo believes he is protected by unearthly forces and engages in voodoo rituals in order to appease the Gods and maintain his power. After robbing a bank, and crossing an old partner, Romeo agrees to steal a truck full of human foetuses for Santos, a paedophile and crime boss, who is to use them for cosmetic experiments. Romeo and Perdita decide to kidnap two gringos in order to kill, sexually abuse and eat them. A surrealistic action packed film, “Perdito Durango” dabbles in the dark arts as a backdrop to a violent spree of bloodshed and mayhem. Some scenes may disturb viewers.

results.title: Penny serenade [DVD]
results.brief_description: Leaving her husband, a woman contemplating divorce recollects in a series of flashbacks the story of her courtship and marriage, the shattering loss of her unborn child, financial struggles, and the emotional upheaval of adopting a child. Stars Irene Dunn and Cary Grant.

results.title: Pelle the conqueror = Pelle Erobreren
results.creator_credit: Per Holst Filmproduktion, Danish Film Institute, Svensk Filmindustri, Per Holst and Bille August
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Martin Andrew Nexos “Pelle the Conqueror” is the epic adventure of two Swedish refugees - eleven year-old Pelle and his elderly, widowed father Lasse (played by Oscar nominee Max Von Sydow). They sail to Denmark in search of a better existence but their dreams quickly fade when they realise that life is not any easier in their new country. Faced with extreme cruelty and poverty, Pelle develops an inner strength that helps him to endure the hardships. Armed with the determination to succeed, he sets out alone to conquer the world. Also stars Pelle Hvengaard, Erik Paaske, Bjorn Granath. Awarded Best Film - Cannes 1988; Best Foreign Film - Oscar 1988 Original subtitled version.
